CustomHttpHeader.name: CustomHttpHeader
CustomHttpHeader.description: Represents a custom HTTP header that provides context information from Salesforce such as region, org details, or the role of the person viewing the external object.

Description.description: A text description of the header field’s purpose.

HeaderFieldName.description: Name of the header field. The name must contain at least one alphanumeric character or underscore. It can also include: ! # $ % & ' * + - . ^ _ ` | ~

HeaderFieldValue.description: A formula that resolves to the value for the header. The values in the formula must evaluate to a string. If the formula resolves to null and an empty string, the header isn’t sent.

IsActive.description: Indicates whether the custom HTTP header is available to use.

ParentId.description: ID of the entity that the custom HTTP header is related to.
